subject: Add extra-specs to the flavor show and detail API calls
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 15888, 'name': 'Zhenyu Zheng', 'email': 'zheng.zhenyu@outlook.com', 'username': 'Kevin_Zheng'}, {'_account_id': 20722, 'name': 'Yikun Jiang', 'email': 'yikunkero@gmail.com', 'username': 'yikunkero'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-03-06 14:50:18.000000000', 'files': ['specs/rocky/approved/add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list.rst'], 'message': 'Add extra-specs to the flavor show and detail API calls

Currently the response of ``GET /flavors/details`` and
``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}`` does not include ``extra_spces`` field,
The users have to call ``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}/extra_specs`` again
to get the extra_specs field.

UIs and SDKs like ``shade`` could time out before all the flavors and
extra-specs are retrieved.

This spec proposed to add a new microversion to the following APIs to
return also ``extra-specs`` of the flavor.

* GET /flavors/details
* GET /flavors/{flavor_id}

APIImpact

Implements: blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list

Change-Id: I0a80ce5f8327bf62766e9d47442c013c0f253737
'}]
commit_message:
Add extra-specs to the flavor show and detail API calls

Currently the response of ``GET /flavors/details`` and
``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}`` does not include ``extra_spces`` field,
The users have to call ``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}/extra_specs`` again
to get the extra_specs field.

UIs and SDKs like ``shade`` could time out before all the flavors and
extra-specs are retrieved.

This spec proposed to add a new microversion to the following APIs to
return also ``extra-specs`` of the flavor.

* GET /flavors/details
* GET /flavors/{flavor_id}

APIImpact

Implements: blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list

Change-Id: I0a80ce5f8327bf62766e9d47442c013c0f253737

subject: Nova: Fix sudoers location in nova-etc configmap
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-14 20:16:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/templates/configmap-etc.yaml'], 'message': 'Nova: Fix sudoers location in nova-etc configmap

The nova_sudoers entry in the nova configmap-etc was consuming
the neutron_sudoers entry in the values.yaml. This corrects it to
point at nova_sudoers instead

Change-Id: I621c817c579cc1c31fa51b1a0f49a43a652784a2
'}]
commit_message:
Nova: Fix sudoers location in nova-etc configmap

The nova_sudoers entry in the nova configmap-etc was consuming
the neutron_sudoers entry in the values.yaml. This corrects it to
point at nova_sudoers instead

Change-Id: I621c817c579cc1c31fa51b1a0f49a43a652784a2

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-12 20:15:05.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': 'Add barbican-tempest experimental job

The barbican-tempest-plugin has tests for
volume encryption, which uses cinder. This
patch adds the barbican-tempest-plugin tests
to the cinder experimental zuulv3 jobs, so
that it can be run against patches that
might affect volume encryption functionality.

Change-Id: If30a4c91134153de02508bae8391eb7014eb1b8b
'}]
commit_message:
Add barbican-tempest experimental job

The barbican-tempest-plugin has tests for
volume encryption, which uses cinder. This
patch adds the barbican-tempest-plugin tests
to the cinder experimental zuulv3 jobs, so
that it can be run against patches that
might affect volume encryption functionality.

Change-Id: If30a4c91134153de02508bae8391eb7014eb1b8b

commit_message:
Add HW_NIC_SRIOV_TRUSTED trait

Adds a new trait to indicate whether all VFs on a PF or a single VF on a
PF is "trusted" and therefore able to operate in promiscuous mode.

Change-Id: If9d4af6ae7158ff8bcab6cdcd979145af307ce84

commit_message:
Add LDAP-backed domain gate

This patch set adds a nv-gating with an OpenLDAP server with some sample
data loaded for development or testing use using a bootstrap job.
This patch set also adds confirming authentication works using  domain-
specific configuration for keystone.

Consolidated change from: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/552976/
Co-Authored-By: Gage Hugo <gagehugo@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I1aeccffc018d0fcefc8e2b15a4ac6b83cb2be8b6
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 10237, 'name': 'Numan Siddique', 'email': 'nusiddiq@redhat.com', 'username': 'numansiddique'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23804, 'name': 'Daniel Alvarez', 'email': 'dalvarez@redhat.com', 'username': 'dalvarez'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-02-23 16:12:10.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/contrib/gate_hook.sh', 'devstack/devstackgaterc', 'networking_ovn/ml2/qos_driver.py', '.gitreview', 'networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_revision_numbers.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_qos_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix CI (QoS and running func tests against OVS 2.9 fixes)

This is a combination of 2 commits as we need both to unblock the gate
right now. One will fix the CI due to QoS changes in neutron and the
other will make functional tests running against OVS 2.9 since master is
currently breaking those. Both depend on each other so this is the
reason behind of the squash.

Fix CI broke because of QoS interface and neutron DB interface changes

all_rules = qos_rule.get_rules(context, policy_id)
TypeError: get_rules() takes exactly 3 arguments (2 given)

qos_rule.get_rules() add a arguments (obj_cls) in this commit:
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/6f83466307fb21aee5bb596974644d457ae1fa60#diff-94eb611a8a3b29dbf8cd2aa2466a53b9R34

This code results in a DB commit for each operation (get_object/delete_object/update_object):
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/6f83466307fb21aee5bb596974644d457ae1fa60#diff-7ed10a69652bc41264bbb5ae42eb8867R526
This led to the port's revision_number increase.

Run tempest release job and functional tests against OVS 2.9

This patch makes both the functional tests and tempest release
job to run against OVS 2.9 which is the latest release at the
time that stable/queens is going to be released.

This is also fixing the functional tests that currently run
against OVS master branch and currently breaks those.

Depends-On: I3ea043758f813f33b4e42eae29b12fadd2e66f7c
Change-Id: I4f3df7b98f7cfcea94367f83f055b3db0450e761
Closes-bug: #1750599
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix CI (QoS and running func tests against OVS 2.9 fixes)

This is a combination of 2 commits as we need both to unblock the gate
right now. One will fix the CI due to QoS changes in neutron and the
other will make functional tests running against OVS 2.9 since master is
currently breaking those. Both depend on each other so this is the
reason behind of the squash.

Fix CI broke because of QoS interface and neutron DB interface changes

all_rules = qos_rule.get_rules(context, policy_id)
TypeError: get_rules() takes exactly 3 arguments (2 given)

qos_rule.get_rules() add a arguments (obj_cls) in this commit:
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/6f83466307fb21aee5bb596974644d457ae1fa60#diff-94eb611a8a3b29dbf8cd2aa2466a53b9R34

This code results in a DB commit for each operation (get_object/delete_object/update_object):
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/6f83466307fb21aee5bb596974644d457ae1fa60#diff-7ed10a69652bc41264bbb5ae42eb8867R526
This led to the port's revision_number increase.

Run tempest release job and functional tests against OVS 2.9

This patch makes both the functional tests and tempest release
job to run against OVS 2.9 which is the latest release at the
time that stable/queens is going to be released.

This is also fixing the functional tests that currently run
against OVS master branch and currently breaks those.

Depends-On: I3ea043758f813f33b4e42eae29b12fadd2e66f7c
Change-Id: I4f3df7b98f7cfcea94367f83f055b3db0450e761
Closes-bug: #1750599
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Auto-configure WSGI worker processes

Automatically configure WSGI worker processes inline with other
charms using the worker-multiplier configuration option and the
WSGI worker configuration context from charm-helpers.

commit_message:
DHCP agent: Handle endpoint with no ipNetworks

If the endpoint has no ipNetworks, treat as deletion.  This happens when
a resync from the mechanism driver overlaps with a port/VM being
deleted.

Before handling this case, we got a traceback like this:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/calico-dhcp-agent", line 10, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py", line 619, in main
    agent.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/osprofiler/profiler.py", line 153, in wrapper
    return f(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py", line 585, in run
    self.etcd.start()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py", line 167, in start
    super(CalicoEtcdWatcher, self).start()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/etcdutils.py", line 323, in start
    self.dispatcher.handle_event(response)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/etcdutils.py", line 73, in handle_event
    self._handle(key_parts, response, self.handler_root, {})
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/etcdutils.py", line 91, in _handle
    handler_node[action](response, **captures)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py", line 278, in on_endpoint_set
    port['network_id'] = self._ensure_net_and_subnets(port)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py", line 325, in _ensure_net_and_subnets
    assert new_subnets
AssertionError

Change-Id: Ic8aa642c8b8c23066bc92e14743b2d0c83ce3459

subject: playbooks: containers-lxc-host: Set correct disk size limit for containers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-14 08:29:56.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/containers-lxc-host.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2'], 'message': 'playbooks: containers-lxc-host: Set correct disk size limit for containers

We need to set the lxc_host_machine_volume_size variable based on the
size of the disk which holds the container images. This avoids spurious
problems in the gates when we run out of disk space inside the
containers.

Change-Id: I3dfea24f6eb9d179174222b907c29126168bbb4e
'}]
commit_message:
playbooks: containers-lxc-host: Set correct disk size limit for containers

We need to set the lxc_host_machine_volume_size variable based on the
size of the disk which holds the container images. This avoids spurious
problems in the gates when we run out of disk space inside the
containers.

Change-Id: I3dfea24f6eb9d179174222b907c29126168bbb4e

The ansible_selinux variable is always populated with a 'status'

Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

commit_message:
Simplify SELinux check

The ansible_selinux variable is always populated with a 'status'
property, even if SELinux is not installed or configured. This
patch simplifies the check.

Change-Id: Ifddc385fc292ddb7d6c2758b199401c45de0f0f2
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

commit_message:
Update config option for collecting sensor data

This patch updates the notification driver option for collecting sensor
data because [DEFAULT]/notification_driver is deprecated and
'messaging' driver should only be used in cases where there are existing
consumers deployed which do not support the 2.0 message format.

Change-Id: Ia6c55149e5cb12d1201742f7008047e35570b410
(cherry picked from commit 013992bf6668d81e7a5649a313f7475907a644b7)

doc update: better introduction, more links

* link to summit presentation videos

commit_message:
Fix overcloud_nodes check failing branch FF

overcloud_nodes|length > 0 fails if overcloud_nodes
is set to empty. This review checks for overcloud_nodes[0]
to be defined.

Closes-Bug: #1755670
Change-Id: I5541c913478241042afd366d93aba00247b48a58

commit_message:
Migrate CLI to cliff

This patch replaces the use of argparse module
by the cliff package. The rationale is that
cliff infrastructure is easier to use and more
functional. Some other OpenStack projects seem
to migrate to cliff already.

Change-Id: Ib2185dad50e64de354222669d2e65f411ddc96a4
Closes-Bug: #1752911

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-03-01 15:49:04.000000000', 'files': ['specs/rocky/approved/placement-forbidden-traits.rst'], 'message': 'Express forbidden traits in placement API

The spec proposes new syntax and handling for expressing traits that
required to _not_ be present in the results of both GET
/resource_providers and GET /allocation_candidates. The proposed
syntax is designed to minimize a profusion of query parameters. But
it may be too weird, so a syntax using a new parameter is also
proposed.

blueprint placement-forbidden-traits

Change-Id: I4e25c0ae28cf7d9aa75ed75e164ae38d9f4eaa54
'}]
commit_message:
Express forbidden traits in placement API

The spec proposes new syntax and handling for expressing traits that
required to _not_ be present in the results of both GET
/resource_providers and GET /allocation_candidates. The proposed
syntax is designed to minimize a profusion of query parameters. But
it may be too weird, so a syntax using a new parameter is also
proposed.

blueprint placement-forbidden-traits

Change-Id: I4e25c0ae28cf7d9aa75ed75e164ae38d9f4eaa54

subject: Avoid tox-install.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-15 07:19:34.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tools/tox_install.sh', 'test-requirements.txt', 'doc/requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install neutron now directly
from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using tox-siblings.

Create doc/requriements.txt for doc requirements as well.

Update tox.ini for this change

Change-Id: Ia46dd4f27ce529a6742d5724e09ddedba6108785
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install neutron now directly
from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using tox-siblings.

Create doc/requriements.txt for doc requirements as well.

Update tox.ini for this change

subject: Initialize privsep infrastructure for Calico DHCP agent
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-03-14 17:29:02.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/devstackgaterc', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/mech_calico.py', 'networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py'], 'message': "Initialize privsep infrastructure for Calico DHCP agent

Also handle removal just now of neutron.common.topics.  That now has to
be neutron_lib.agent.topics.

Also enhance the code in our gate hook that emits Calico diags, so that
it doesn't barf itself if something else goes wrong so as to prevent the
whole test from running.

Also remove test_cross_tenant_traffic from the set of Tempest tests that
we run.  This test has been occasionally flaky for a long time, but now
it seems to have increased in failure rate to about 50%.  It has always
been outside the scope that Calico for OpenStack covers, however, so
seems sensible now to just remove it, given that the increased failure
rate is impacting our ability to get good networking-calico changes
merged.

(Technical explanation: This test creates one VM each for two tenants
and tests connectivity between those, subject to appropriate SG config.
The problem for Calico is that both of those VMs get the same IP address
- which Calico does not support because it requires all endpoints to
share an address space.

Specifically what then goes wrong is that one of the VMs does not get
the SSH key metadata that it should; its console log includes:

  ### /etc/init.d/sshd start
  Top of dropbear init script
  Starting dropbear sshd: remove-dropbear-host-keys already run per instance
  WARN: generating key of type ecdsa failed!
  FAIL

I think this is because correct metadata operation with overlapping IPs
requires use of the Neutron metadata agent, and we don't run that in our
DevStack CI setup; instead we run the Nova metadata agent, which is
simpler but only for a single shared address space.

Lack of that key metadata means that a later SSH into that VM fails.

FWIW, other aspects of Calico surprisingly _do_ still work.  (1) The
DHCP agent runs separate dnsmasq instances per tenant, and it's fine for
each of those to hand out the same IP address.  (2) It's ambiguous which
VM the compute host will route to for <the shared fixed IP>, but in this
particular test and setup that doesn't matter because the test maps a
floating IP to the target VM and uses that for SSH, and Felix also
programs a route for <floating IP> to the relevant TAP interface.

So ultimately it's just the SSH key metadata that causes this test to
fail.)

I've had to include _all_ of the above changes in this same commit,
because they are all needed in order for networking-calico CI to pass
again.

Change-Id: Ida567c33bb868e1b4a658fbc3cfc16f3e3b0610d
"}]
commit_message:
Initialize privsep infrastructure for Calico DHCP agent

Also handle removal just now of neutron.common.topics.  That now has to
be neutron_lib.agent.topics.

Also enhance the code in our gate hook that emits Calico diags, so that
it doesn't barf itself if something else goes wrong so as to prevent the
whole test from running.

Also remove test_cross_tenant_traffic from the set of Tempest tests that
we run.  This test has been occasionally flaky for a long time, but now
it seems to have increased in failure rate to about 50%.  It has always
been outside the scope that Calico for OpenStack covers, however, so
seems sensible now to just remove it, given that the increased failure
rate is impacting our ability to get good networking-calico changes
merged.

(Technical explanation: This test creates one VM each for two tenants
and tests connectivity between those, subject to appropriate SG config.
The problem for Calico is that both of those VMs get the same IP address
- which Calico does not support because it requires all endpoints to
share an address space.

Specifically what then goes wrong is that one of the VMs does not get
the SSH key metadata that it should; its console log includes:

  ### /etc/init.d/sshd start
  Top of dropbear init script
  Starting dropbear sshd: remove-dropbear-host-keys already run per instance
  WARN: generating key of type ecdsa failed!
  FAIL

I think this is because correct metadata operation with overlapping IPs
requires use of the Neutron metadata agent, and we don't run that in our
DevStack CI setup; instead we run the Nova metadata agent, which is
simpler but only for a single shared address space.

Lack of that key metadata means that a later SSH into that VM fails.

FWIW, other aspects of Calico surprisingly _do_ still work.  (1) The
DHCP agent runs separate dnsmasq instances per tenant, and it's fine for
each of those to hand out the same IP address.  (2) It's ambiguous which
VM the compute host will route to for <the shared fixed IP>, but in this
particular test and setup that doesn't matter because the test maps a
floating IP to the target VM and uses that for SSH, and Felix also
programs a route for <floating IP> to the relevant TAP interface.

So ultimately it's just the SSH key metadata that causes this test to
fail.)

I've had to include _all_ of the above changes in this same commit,
because they are all needed in order for networking-calico CI to pass
again.

Change-Id: Ida567c33bb868e1b4a658fbc3cfc16f3e3b0610d

commit_message:
Add descriptions for config option choices

oslo.config 5.2.0 changed some of the options
(oslo_config.cfg.StrOpt & PortOpt) so that
the choices parameter will now accept a sequence
of tuples, where each tuple is of the form
(choice, description).

If a description is not provided, the sample
config file is generated with
'<No description provided>' next to the choices.

This adds descriptions to the choices.

Change-Id: I7e32ff8e86d2760af49fd088188b94d19ca76e84
Closes-Bug: #1755914

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2018-03-14 02:50:02.000000000', 'files': ['.testr.conf', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Reduce stestr concurrency to 1 for tempest jobs

The switch from ostestr to stestr introduced in Change-Id
Ie6a275170ec6faf0db3976410660f52078710a54 missed setting concurrency
jobs to 1 for api and scenario tests, leading to intermittent gate
issues.

aforementioned Change-Id.

'}]
commit_message:
Reduce stestr concurrency to 1 for tempest jobs

The switch from ostestr to stestr introduced in Change-Id
Ie6a275170ec6faf0db3976410660f52078710a54 missed setting concurrency
jobs to 1 for api and scenario tests, leading to intermittent gate
issues.

This patch also fixes coverage test that got broken in the
aforementioned Change-Id.

Change-Id: I077330ad6f0308845d1b5330040be6f92c39580d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-08 18:07:36.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'message': 'Remove cloud-init and disable os-collect-config

A user uses a guest image for the undercloud, cloud-init may be
installed which can also cause other services like os-collect-config to
be running. We should ensure that cloud-init is removed and that the
os-collect-config service is disable to prevent it from interfering with
overcloud deployments.

Change-Id: I58f6fc4b299c8f1f561205ac9a2de75c46467ba8
Closes-Bug: #1754426
'}]
commit_message:
Remove cloud-init and disable os-collect-config

A user uses a guest image for the undercloud, cloud-init may be
installed which can also cause other services like os-collect-config to
be running. We should ensure that cloud-init is removed and that the
os-collect-config service is disable to prevent it from interfering with
overcloud deployments.

Change-Id: I58f6fc4b299c8f1f561205ac9a2de75c46467ba8
Closes-Bug: #1754426

subject: Fix gnocchi-upgrade Table <..> already exists errors
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6924, 'name': 'Pradeep Kilambi', 'email': 'pkilambi@redhat.com', 'username': 'pkilambi'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20936, 'name': 'Raoul Scarazzini', 'email': 'rasca@mmul.it', 'username': 'rasca'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-14 19:54:15.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/gnocchi-api.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix gnocchi-upgrade Table <..> already exists errors

Currently we are calling /usr/bin/gnocchi-upgrade
--sacks-number=SACK_NUM from each node where gnocchi-api is part of the
role. gnocchi-upgrade seems to be racy and we sometimes end up with the
following error:

commit_message:
Fix gnocchi-upgrade Table <..> already exists errors

Currently we are calling /usr/bin/gnocchi-upgrade
--sacks-number=SACK_NUM from each node where gnocchi-api is part of the
role. gnocchi-upgrade seems to be racy and we sometimes end up with the
following error:

2018-03-14 12:39:39,683 [1] ERROR    oslo_db.sqlalchemy.exc_filters: DBAPIError exception wrapped from (pymysql.err.InternalError) (1050, u"Table 'archive_policy' already exists") [SQL: u'\nCREATE TABLE archive_policy (\n\tname VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, \n\tback_window INTEGER NOT NULL, \n\tdefinition TEXT NOT NULL, \n\taggregation_methods TEXT NOT NULL, \n\tPRIMARY KEY (name)\n)ENGINE=InnoDB CHARSET=utf8\n\n']
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1182, in _execute_context
    context)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 470, in do_execute
    cursor.execute(statement, parameters)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/cursors.py", line 166, in execute
    result = self._query(query)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/cursors.py", line 322, in _query
    conn.query(q)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/connections.py", line 856, in query
    self._affected_rows = self._read_query_result(unbuffered=unbuffered)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/connections.py", line 1057, in _read_query_result
    result.read()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/connections.py", line 1340, in read
    first_packet = self.connection._read_packet()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/connections.py", line 1014, in _read_packet
    packet.check_error()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/connections.py", line 393, in check_error
    err.raise_mysql_exception(self._data)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/err.py", line 107, in raise_mysql_exception
    raise errorclass(errno, errval)
InternalError: (1050, u"Table 'archive_policy' already exists")

Let's run it from a the bootstrap node by wrapping it into the
bootstrap_host_exec magic.

Change-Id: I106512eeffff3425608a543f9bc5e6a9508d15e5
Closes-Bug: #1755564

commit_message:
Add fast_forward_upgrade_tasks for ceilometer services

Adds ffu_tasks for ceilometer - stop services on step 1.
In the docker/ templates services are also disabled.

Lots of changes for ceilo-* since Newton:
  --> openstack-ceilometer-api, -collector and -expirer are
      removed in Pike and no longer in the templates. The disable
      files are re-added by the parent review so these services
      can be retired with ffu_tasks.
  --> The disabled services are set back in environment for Fast
      Forward Upgrade

Change-Id: I1c8ac2285ab222cfb7cb7ff898d222ae6e846567
(cherry picked from commit 92624d6730c47f83d7a97959093a916b5e4e69af)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-09 16:30:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'trivial: Rename reboot kwarg to hard_reboot

This is a trivial refactor of the libvirt driver to make it clear that
the reboot boolean used by _create_domain_and_network only relates to
hard reboots where we fully destroy a domain, unplug VIFs, disconnect
volumes etc before reconnecting volumes, re-plugging VIFs and recreating
the domain.

Soft reboots are handled through a different codepath and so the naming
of this argument could easily confuse anyone reviewing this method and
anything we pass the boolean on to.

Change-Id: I7b3e890b9a95984be71f224345ff59272e0b02c0
'}]
commit_message:
trivial: Rename reboot kwarg to hard_reboot

This is a trivial refactor of the libvirt driver to make it clear that
the reboot boolean used by _create_domain_and_network only relates to
hard reboots where we fully destroy a domain, unplug VIFs, disconnect
volumes etc before reconnecting volumes, re-plugging VIFs and recreating
the domain.

Soft reboots are handled through a different codepath and so the naming
of this argument could easily confuse anyone reviewing this method and
anything we pass the boolean on to.

Change-Id: I7b3e890b9a95984be71f224345ff59272e0b02c0

subject: use plugin common utils from neutron-lib
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-08 21:05:03.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_trunk_driver.py'], 'message': 'use plugin common utils from neutron-lib

The public APIs that are part of neutron.plugins.common.utils were
rehomed into neutron-lib with Iabb155b5d2d0ec6104ebee5dd42cf292bdf3ec61
and will removed in neutron with commit
I1d63cbea463e92e1d2e053f8e1a564ed52cb84f8

This patch consumes the common plugin utils from neutron-lib

NOTE: We will have to rehome create_port and consume it before we can
land the neutron patch.

Change-Id: I78d74718fbfce35a2b51b717fc97274b38e5c583
'}]
commit_message:
use plugin common utils from neutron-lib

The public APIs that are part of neutron.plugins.common.utils were
rehomed into neutron-lib with Iabb155b5d2d0ec6104ebee5dd42cf292bdf3ec61
and will removed in neutron with commit
I1d63cbea463e92e1d2e053f8e1a564ed52cb84f8

This patch consumes the common plugin utils from neutron-lib

NOTE: We will have to rehome create_port and consume it before we can
land the neutron patch.

Change-Id: I78d74718fbfce35a2b51b717fc97274b38e5c583

subject: Move neutron to requirements.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-15 09:27:08.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tools/tox_install.sh'], 'message': 'Move neutron to requirements.txt

Since neutron is now in
global-requirements, we can remove the installation from
tools/tox_install.sh.

Note that neutron is still installed from git thanks to tox-siblings
in OpenStack CI.

Change-Id: I27183e188335bb3002079c0c5743d09e9972bad4
'}]
commit_message:
Move neutron to requirements.txt

Since neutron is now in
global-requirements, we can remove the installation from
tools/tox_install.sh.

Note that neutron is still installed from git thanks to tox-siblings
in OpenStack CI.

Change-Id: I27183e188335bb3002079c0c5743d09e9972bad4

commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add neutron to requirements file.

Change-Id: Iac4eceb6201724b6e9c3ee967139a4c10ee62f9b

commit_message:
Ensure ceph-ansible playbooks are run one at a time

Previously if we passed a list of ceph-ansible playbooks to run
Mistral would trigger them in parallel.

Change-Id: Ia21f426d9c0961edd148c26fd6c22eb03c5bcf2f

commit_message:
Fix the old or invalid doc links

The urls in docs are old or invalid.
Replace them with the right ones for the docs according to
the official OpenStack websites.
